Description: Corroded copper alloy small amuletic figure of a double ichneumon (?) on a rectangular / oval base, with remains of a suspension ring on top, in the middle.
Curator's comments: Possibly one of the bronze figures of "sacred animals" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.64, p.181, pl.23)
